text: The Saudi Arabian coat of arms () is a coat of arms that was adopted in 1950.Flags of the World, Saudi Arabia page According to the Saudi ConstitutionSaudi Basic Law of Government, Article 4 it is made of of two crossed swords with a palm tree in the open upper space between the blades. Each of the swords represents the two kingdoms which founded modern day Saudi Arabia, the Kingdom of Hejaz and the Sultanate of Najd. The date palm tree represents vitality and growth. The crossed Shamshir symbolize justice and strength rooted in faith. == References == Saudi Arabia Category:National symbols of Saudi Arabia
title: Coat of arms of Saudi Arabia
